intro: Gratiola saginoides var. violacea, commonly known as the violet leaf gravel root, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, and its tuberous roots are adapted for storing water and nutrients. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its unique foliage and floral display.
